image.altText: Close up Albanese, smiling, scaffolding in background.

props.synopsis: The crucible of a campaign tests who has what it takes to be a leader. With less than a week to go, we're starting to see who has passed the test.

title.children: Albanese eyes history — unless Dutton pulls off a last-minute miracle

image.altText: A composite image of three women and a man

props.synopsis: The ABC revisited American voters from across the political spectrum about their thoughts and feelings almost 100 days into Trump's second term.

title.children: We checked in on American voters almost 100 days into Trump 2.0

image.altText: Two men sitting on chairs

props.synopsis: Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskyy meet for the first time since their infamous February Oval Office stoush, amid protracted US-led attempts to broker a ceasefire between Russia and Ukraine.

title.children: Trump meets Zelenskyy at pope's funeral, then blasts Putin on social media

image.altText: A woman closes her eyes while standing between two men

props.synopsis: Pope Francis may have been a humble man beloved by Catholics around the world, but his funeral was still a star-studded affair. These were the key moments you missed.

title.children: The Pope's funeral featured royals, mourners and a surprise meeting

image.altText: A graphic of Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton cut-outs

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese will hold a rally in Western Sydney to announce a $200 million pledge to rebrand the free 24/7 health advice service, as Peter Dutton begins a final week blitz of seats ahead of tonight's leaders debate. Follow live.

title.children: Dutton begins seat blitz, almost 3 million Australians vote early

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: AEC says nearly 3 million Australians have already voted
Dutton embarks on final week campaign blitz

image.altText: A gas flare with a line graph indicating gas prices

props.synopsis: Gas has been making lots of headlines throughout this election campaign. As we enter the final week, there are a few things to know about gas, how much of it we use, and what role it plays in our power bills.

title.children: The six things you should know about gas and if it can make power cheaper

image.altText: A sepia-tinged photo of a man holding a large crocodile.

props.synopsis: A crocodile wrangler from the country may sound like an unlikely advocate for LGBTQIA+ Australians in parliament. But Warren Entsch is just that — and it all started in a pub.

title.children: A croc-wrangling MP, his trans friend and Australia's same-sex marriage push

image.altText: Albanese democracy sausage Tasmania

props.synopsis: The $200 million election commitment rebrands and expands an existing health hotline.

title.children: 'Life isn't 9 to 5': Labor promises free, after-hours GP hotline

image.altText: a man wearing army uniform speaking at a lectern

props.synopsis: The head of Australia's anti-corruption watchdog has been repeatedly photographed in full military regalia since taking on the $780,000 a year role.

title.children: Anti-corruption watchdog boss's defence links spark impartiality concerns

image.altText: Q+A/YouGov Poll 28 April 2025

props.synopsis: Most Australians believe the United States can no longer be relied on for security in a "fundamental change of worldview", research for Q+A shows.

title.children: 'Trump won't save us': Australians' radical shift on US relations

image.altText: A white blonde woman sits next to an older man in a court room

props.synopsis: After a high-profile mistrial, the controversial case of Karen Read is back in court as her legal team continues to say she's being framed.

title.children: Karen Read says police killed her boyfriend. She's charged with his murder

image.altText: A woman in bushland looking away from the camera

props.synopsis: Vaccine Nation is a warning about the acceleration of the anti-vaccination movement during the pandemic and worrying declines in vaccination rates around the world. Can we correct course before it's too late?

title.children: COVID jabs were a resounding success but vaccines now face a growing threat

image.altText: elon musk shrugs while standing in front of a seated donald trump in the oval office

props.synopsis: Experts say it could be too late for Tesla to "separate the man from the machine" as Elon Musk's personal brand hits an all-time low.

title.children: Musk has refocused on Tesla but experts say the 'rot has set in' already

image.altText: A series of ads for both liberal and labor party members, each represented respectively either by the colour blue or red.

props.synopsis: The federal election campaign battle on Chinese social media platforms has intensified, with a surge in candidates seeking to win over Chinese-Australian voters.

title.children: An intensifying election battle is unfolding on Chinese social media apps

image.altText: A husband and wife standing on a staircase outside their shop.

props.synopsis: Despite recent environmental and animal welfare concerns, supporters of Tasmania's salmon industry say it provides critical economic benefits to regional communities.

title.children: Pro or anti-salmon? The debate is affecting both sides of the Huon community

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: Looking for a chance to embarrass yourself? Today's your lucky day.

title.children: Like a quiz with a serving of sass? Come on in. Let's play … HARD!

image.altText: Max Chandler-Mather handing out how-to-vote cards.

props.synopsis: After the Greens took over three new seats in Queensland's south-east in 2022, political analysts predicted the party was headed for a "surge" in popularity. But according to the polls, their primary vote is only marginally up from where it was three years ago.

title.children: Queensland's Greens seats 'now in play' after popularity surge in 2022

image.altText: Woman wearing red plaid shirt standing in covered patio.

props.synopsis: Can one partner meet all of our emotional and sexual needs? Meet the polyamorous Australians questioning relationship norms, and redefining what love and loyalty looks like.

title.children: What is 'ethical non-monogamy' and why are more Australians considering it?

image.altText: The central business district of Port Augusta with wind turbines in the distance.

props.synopsis: Port Augusta is one of seven locations across the country earmarked to host nuclear power plants if the Coalition wins the federal election, but the community has mixed views on the proposal.

title.children: Nuclear power is earmarked for Port Augusta, but reactions are mixed

image.altText: crowds of people protest in tel aviv holding signs of the hostages faces who were taken by Hamas

props.synopsis: The families demand Benjamin Netanyahu end the war, saying if he refuses, they will "take action to topple him in order to save the hostages".

title.children: Families threaten to topple Netanyahu to 'save' Israeli hostages

image.altText: Smoke from an explosion is seen at a port in Iran

props.synopsis: The blast happened at the Shahid Rajaei port just outside a major facility for container shipments for the Islamic Republic that handles some 80 million tons of goods annually.

title.children: Chemicals blamed for fatal port blast in Southern Iran that injured hundreds

image.altText: Image of thick vines with grapes on them.

props.synopsis: Once almost lost, these fragile old vines are now the focus of DNA testing and efforts to preserve Australia's oldest vineyards.

title.children: Australia's wine roots run a lot deeper than you think

image.altText: Older man with arm around woman holding stubby coolers, wearing hats, standing in front of back of tin house.

props.synopsis: As property prices continue to skyrocket across most of Australia, there are still pockets of cheap homes in regional communities.

title.children: Tiny town with properties under $100k keeps home ownership dream alive

image.altText: Rob McElhenney and Ryan Reynolds celebrate with a trophy after being promoted to the Championship.

props.synopsis: Four years after actors Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney purchased Wrexham, the Welsh football club is a step closer to achieving the goal of reaching the top-flight Premier League.

title.children: Reynolds, McElhenney and Wrexham one step closer to ‘impossible dream’

image.altText: A man gestures with his finger while speaking at a lectern in front of a banner reading PAP

props.synopsis: Singaporean law bars foreigners from publishing online election advertising, which it defines as online materials that could help or hurt any candidate.

title.children: Singapore orders Facebook to take down post by Australian

image.altText: A musclar man wearing a helmet carries equipment.

props.synopsis: A home restored to its original 1960s look is part of a project documenting the history of a West Australian iron ore town.

title.children: 'Retro house' celebrates outback town's mining history

props.synopsis: The National Library is asking for contributions to its election ephemera collection which it's been building since federation, collecting posters of former Prime Minister John Howard, flyers for Kevin ’07 and even how to vote cards from the early 1900s.

title.children: Election pamphlets may be 'annoying' but they tell a story of Australia

image.altText: Virginia Roberts Giuffre

props.synopsis: She exposed the elite and broke her silence — now she's gone, but her story refuses to die.

title.children: Staring down the elite, Virginia Giuffre refused to be silenced

image.altText: Alex de Minaur pumps his fist at Madrid Open.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur begins his Madrid Open campaign in style, but 24-time major winner Novak Djokovic crashes out in straight sets.

title.children: De Minaur thrives at Madrid Open as Djokovic slumps again

image.altText: A badge for Victoria Police

props.synopsis: Three people are in hospital following a stabbing and a car crash involving a tram stop in Melbourne's CBD this morning.

title.children: 21yo man in hospital after being stabbed by teenage girl in Melbourne

image.altText: A bilby.

props.synopsis: Years of fires, landclearing and introduced predators have seen Australia's bilby population plummet but a glimmer of hope exists within six protected areas.

title.children: Sacrificing sleep to search for bilbies under the stars

image.altText: Auckland FC players celebrate a goal in the A-League Men competition.

props.synopsis: A-League Men newcomer Auckland FC secures the Premiers Plate after Melbourne City was held to a 0—0 draw by Adelaide United.

title.children: Auckland FC wins A-League Men premiership in first season

image.altText: Eleanor Patterson competing in the high jump at the 2025 Maurie Plant Meet.

props.synopsis: Australian high jumpers Eleanor Patterson and Nicola Olyslagers secure top-three finishes at the Xiamen Diamond League meet, while sprinter Lachlan Kennedy places fifth in 100m.

title.children: Aussie Patterson second at Diamond League opener, Kennedy fifth on debut

image.altText: A red-headed woman with glasses sits near a playground.

props.synopsis: There are calls for more funding to be made available to local governments to help maintain footpath networks and improve accessibility for people living with disabilities.

title.children: Dodgy footpaths wreaking havoc for people living with disability

image.altText: A woman in glasses holds her baby who wears a grey wiggles jumpsuit.

props.synopsis: The mother-of-two is among a growing number of people seeking out food relief for the first time, which includes families and people with stable jobs and mortgages.

title.children: Skylee turned to free food pantries to feed her family and she's far from alone
